## {data-menu-title="Nonstationary models need more parameters"}

### NONSTATIONARY MODELS {style="font-size: 2.25em;"}

####  NEED MORE PARAMETERS {.text-brick-red style="font-size: 1.75em; margin-left: 50px;"}

::: {.fragment .fade-in}
Generic nonstationary model for annual maximum precipitation:
$$
y(\mathbf{s}, t) \sim \text{GEV} \left( \mu(\mathbf{s}, t), \sigma(\mathbf{s}, t), \xi(\mathbf{s}, t) \right)
$$
:::

::: {.fragment .fade-in}
Process-informed models condition parameters on climate indices $\mathbf{x}(t)$ [@schlef_idf:2023;@cheng_nonstationary:2014]
$$
\theta(\mathbf{s}, t) = \alpha + \underbrace{\sum_{j=1}^J \beta_j(\mathbf{s}) x_j(t)}_\text{additional parameters}
$$
:::
